title: People's hearts were breaking for mother Sally Evans watching My Son The Jihadist
text:
People's hearts were breaking for mother Sally Evans watching My Son The Jihadist People's hearts were breaking for mother Sally Evans watching My Son The Jihadist 
Press Association 2014 / / National Entertainment News Share 
Four years and four days after Sally Evans last saw her son Thomas, she identified his dead body on a photograph which had started to circulate on the internet. 
Sally said she was simultaneously devastated and relieved at his death. 
He was killed in Kenya where he was part of the Al Shabaab terror group. Sally Evans shows a photograph of her son Thomas during his schooldays (Richard Ansett/Channel 4) 
Channel 4 documentary My Son The Jihadist followed the struggles that mother Sally and her younger son Michael, Thomas‚Äôs brother, went through after Thomas left the UK in 2011. Midway through filming, Sally learned of her son‚Äôs death. 
Before then, Sally received sporadic phone calls from her son, eventually learning that he had married a 14-year-old Somalian girl. More notes from Sally‚Äôs phone conversations with her son Thomas. #MySonTheJihadi pic.twitter.com/mFlKBaIJ5U 
‚Äî Channel 4 (@Channel4) October 22, 2015 
The daughter-in-law took to calling Sally, despite the language barrier and even asked for money. Thomas‚Äôs widow was proud that he had died as a ‚Äúmartyr‚Äù. Thomas Evans seen in a video recorded the day before his death (Channel 4) 
But Sally shared different views telling her daughter-in-law, through an interpreter, that her son will ‚Äúburn in hell for what he has done‚Äù. Sally, speaking on the phone with the mother of her 14 year old daughter in law. #MySonTheJihadi pic.twitter.com/ooTVarLPEs 
‚Äî Channel 4 (@Channel4) October 22, 2015 
Viewers struggled to cope with how Thomas had switched from a typical British-upbringing to life as a high-ranking member of Al Shabaab. 
But as viewers watched along on Twitter, there was a massive outpouring of support for his mother, and the obvious anguish she had over her son‚Äôs apparent role in a massacre the year before his death. Feel for the mum.. üòñ #MySonTheJihadi
